title: We Can Win the Fight for Union Rights at GHC
description: Our attendance at this meeting will help end GHC's anti-union policies and win GHC workers their union!
raw_text:
WE CAN WIN THE FIGHT FOR UNION RIGHTS AT GHC!
Our coalition of GHC workers, patients, and community supporters has won a special membership meeting on unionization.
OUR ATTENDANCE AT THIS MEETING WILL HELP END GHC‚ÄôS ANTI-UNION POLICIES AND WIN GHC WORKERS THEIR UNION!

WHEN: MONDAY OCT. 13 AT 5:30PM - RALLY AND PRESS CONFERENCE AT 4:30PM!

WHERE: ALLIANT ENERGY CENTER
MENDOTA ROOMS 5-7.
1919 ALLIANT ENERGY CENTER WAY, MADISON, WI 53713

ATTENDANCE IS IN-PERSON ONLY.

EACH GHC PATIENT, INCLUDING ANY ADULT (18+) ON A FAMILY PLAN, NEEDS TO REGISTER!

1. SCAN HERE TO REGISTER FOR THE MEETING!

2. SCAN HERE TO LET US KNOW YOU‚ÄôLL BE THERE!

WWW.OURGHC.COM GHCWORKERSUNITED@GMAIL.COM

Centralia, Washington

title: NO KINGS
description: Our peaceful movement is only getting bigger and stronger. ‚ÄúNO KINGS‚Äù is more than just a slogan‚Äîit‚Äôs the foundation our nation was built upon. Born in the streets, carried by millions in chants and on posters, it echoes from city blocks to rural town squares, uniting people across this country to fight dictatorship together. In America, we don‚Äôt have kings, and we won‚Äôt back down against chaos, corruption, and cruelty. Grow our movement and join us. A core principle behind all No Kings events is a commitment to nonviolent action. We expect all participants to seek to de-escalate any potential confrontation with those who disagree with our values and to act lawfully at these events. title: Fighting Dictatorship Together
description: We are organizing a protest against the administration's actions, including court defiance, deportations, and service cuts. This movement is for those who think the government has gone too far.
address: At the big flag where Pacific Ave & 19th Way split
raw_text:
Fighting Dictatorship Together
SATURDAY, OCT 18

NO THRONES! NO CROWNS! NO KINGS

This is bigger than political disagreement. The administration has defied our courts, deported American citizens, disappeared people off the streets, and slashed our services‚Äîall while orchestrating a massive giveaway to their billionaire allies. Enough is enough. For anyone who thinks they‚Äôve gone too far, this movement is for you.

title: Skills for Disagreeing Better Workshop
description: A free Braver Angels in-person event focused on developing communication skills to improve understanding across political divides.
sponsors: The League of Women Voters Ames & Story County
raw_text: Let's learn to disagree better, TOGETHER.  Join us for a FREE workshop in Ames!  Feeling tired of the constant political division?  What if we could build the skills to communicate across our differences with respect and clarity?  This FREE in-person workshop is a Braver Angels event designed to do just that.  ‚ÄúSkills for Disagreeing Better‚Äù is about learning practical skills to listen so others feel heard, and to share your own views in a way that others can hear.  WHEN: Sunday, November 2nd, 2 - 4 PM CST  WHERE: Ames Public Library, 515 Douglas Ave., Ames  COST: FREE (Donations welcome)  Scan the code below to register! Use promo code "BRAVER" and select "Free Ticket" at checkout to reserve your spot.  HOSTED BY  Ames Public Library  Indivisible Ames  The League of Women Voters Ames & Story County  Democracy Every Day  Ames Area Religious Leaders Association (AARLA)
raw_summary: The image is an invitation to a free workshop called "Skills for Disagreeing Better" hosted by Braver Angels. It's aimed at teaching communication skills for navigating political divisions. The event is scheduled for November 2nd at Ames Public Library, in Ames, Iowa. The event is hosted by multiple organizations including the Ames Public Library and Indivisible Ames.
